revised_title: Exploring Primordial Black Holes with Atmospheric Cherenkov Technique in Gamma-Ray Astronomy
tldr: This article discusses the use of the atmospheric Cherenkov technique in gamma-ray astronomy to search for exploding primordial black holes. The technique involves detecting the Cherenkov radiation produced when high-energy particles interact with the Earth's atmosphere. The authors describe the setup and limitations of this method, as well as potential improvements and future applications.
